Follows a practical guide:

drawing

In this page you can upload a graph (written by its edges) in the following CSV format:


source,target
b,a
b,c
c,e
e,f
f,b
a,f
a,d
d,b
c,f


 The file must necessarily be in the 'CSVs' folder. The display of the graph can highlight the inverted edges in red if we had used a heuristic to get it. For example this is the csv output file product by dfs-based heuristic. The value 0 shows that the edge has been inverted:


source,target,value
b,a,1
b,c,1
a,f,1
a,d,1
c,e,1
f,c,0
f,e,0
b,f,0
b,d,0

heuristics: dfs, leftwards, greedy

In the follows GitHub Readme there is an overview about the heuristics I implemented:

link to github README.md

In dfs, leftwards, and greedy pages, we can select the csv file, confirm file pushing 'ok', when we push 'execute' we obtain a new representation without cycle of the graph. It's possible export a new csv (graph without cycle) using the form below.
